channel.title: How to read tiles from a tileset?
channel.description:
Hi guys. I've got an image like this:
[img]http://img481.imageshack.us/img481/7035/platformtilesetsu2.gif[/img]
and I was wondering if there was a function that could read a specific tile, like readASpecificTile(32, 32, 48, 48). In that made-up function, it would read the image data from the 32nd pixel corner to the 48th pixel corner into an image object or something.
Is there a way to do this in Java?

item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“White Castle, post:2, topic:133319”]BufferedImage tileSet = ImageIO.read(new File("tile_set.png")); BufferedImage tile = tileSet.getSubimage(int x, int y, int width, int height);[/quote]

Thank you so much!

Edit: ImageIO is javax.ImageIO, right?
